sledgehammer.lua.permissions

Class PermissionObject<M extends MongoUniqueNodeDocument>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.util.Printable
      • sledgehammer.lua.LuaObject
        • sledgehammer.lua.LuaTable
          • sledgehammer.lua.MongoLuaObject<M>
            • sledgehammer.lua.permissions.PermissionObject<M>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PermissionGroup, PermissionUser

    public abstract class PermissionObject<M extends MongoUniqueNodeDocument>
extends MongoLuaObject<M>
    MongoLuaObject to handle general permission-object data and operations for the Permissions Module.
    Author:
    Jab

    • Method Detail

      • setMongoDocument

        protected void setMongoDocument(M mongoDocument)
        (Protected Method)

        Sets the MongoUniqueNodeDocument strong the data for the PermissionObject, and loads the Node containers for the MongoNodes registered to the document.

        Overrides:
        setMongoDocument in class MongoLuaObject<M extends MongoUniqueNodeDocument>
        Parameters:
        mongoDocument - The MongoUniqueNodeDocument to set.

      • setPermission

        public Node setPermission(java.lang.String nodeAsString,
                          java.lang.Boolean flag,
                          boolean save)
        Sets a permission Node if one exists, or creates a permission Node if one does not exists.
        Parameters:
        nodeAsString - The node in String format.
        flag - The flag to set for the Node. Set to node to get rid of the Node.
        save - The flag to save the Document.
        Returns:
        Returns the result Node with the flag set.

      • hasAnyPermission

        public boolean hasAnyPermission(java.lang.String superNodeAsString)
        Parameters:
        superNodeAsString - The String node being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns true if any sub-node of the provided String node is granted.

      • getSubPermissions

        public java.util.List<Node> getSubPermissions(java.lang.String node)
        Parameters:
        node - The String node used to test the PermissionNodes assigned
        Returns:
        Returns a List of any PermissionNodes that are a sub-node to the String node given.

      • hasSubPermission

        public boolean hasSubPermission(java.lang.String node)
        Tests whether or not the PermissionObject contains an assigned sub-PermissionNode for the given String node.
        Parameters:
        node - The String super-node being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the PermissionObject has an assigned sub-node to the String super-node tested.

      • getPermissionNode

        public Node getPermissionNode(java.lang.String node)
        Attempts to grab the closest PermissionNode that is defined in the embodying Permission entity, and returns it.
        Parameters:
        node - The String node being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns a PermissionNode for the String node, or a PermissionNode that is a super-node of that node is defined. Returns null if no PermissionNode is found.

      • getAllSubPermissionNodes

        public java.util.List<Node> getAllSubPermissionNodes(java.lang.String superNodeAsString)
        Parameters:
        superNodeAsString - The String node to test.
        Returns:
        Returns a List of Nodes that are sub-nodes of the String super-node given.

      • getClosestPermissionNode

        public Node getClosestPermissionNode(java.lang.String node)
        Attempts to grab the most specific definition for a given String node.

        (Note: If the node is explicitly defined, that PermissionNode will be returned.)

        Parameters:
        node - The String node being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns the closest PermissionNode if one is found.

      • getExplicitPermissionNode

        public Node getExplicitPermissionNode(java.lang.String node)
        Returns a PermissionNode with the given node in String form.
        Parameters:
        node - The String format of the node.
        Returns:
        Returns a PermissionNode if one exists for the PermissionObject.

      • isAnyNodeGranted

        public static boolean isAnyNodeGranted(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Parameters:
        nodes - The List of Nodes being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns true if any of the Nodes in the List given are flagged true.

      • getGrantedNodes

        public static java.util.List<Node> getGrantedNodes(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Parameters:
        nodes - The List of Nodes being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns a List of Nodes that are granted. If none in the List provided are granted, the List will return empty.

      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(java.lang.String node)
        Parameters:
        node - The String node being tested.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the PermissionObject grants the String node being tested.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(Node node,
                    boolean save)
        Adds a permission Node to the PermissionObject
        Parameters:
        node - The permission Node to add.
        save - The flag to save the Document.

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(Node node,
                       boolean save)
        Removes a Node if it is assigned to the PermissionObject.
        Parameters:
        node - The Node to remove.
        save - Flag for saving the document after removing the node.

      • loadNodes

        (Private Method)

        Constructs the Node containers from the MongoUniqueNodeDocument.

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the MongoDocument for the PermissionObject.

      • getPermissionMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Node> getPermissionMap()
        Returns:
        Returns the Map of Node entries for the PermissionObject, identified by the String Node format.

      • getPermissionNodes

        public java.util.Collection<Node> getPermissionNodes()
        Returns:
        Returns a Collection of the Nodes assigned to the PermissionObject.
